title: How to Make Eggnog Cupcakes

steps.headline: Line a cupcake tray with paper liners.
Blend the cake mix, eggs, and eggnog in a large bowl.
steps.description: Blend on high speed using an electric mixer until the cake batter resemble a white color.

steps.headline: Stir in the nutmeg and vanilla.
steps.description: Blend on medium speed using the electric mixer until well combined.

steps.headline: Scoop the batter into a cupcake tray.
Bake the cupcakes for about 18-20 minutes, until they rise and are golden brown.
Allow the cupcakes to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
Cream the butter and cream cheese in a medium-sized bowl until light and fluffy.
Fold in the powdered sugar and add the eggnog.
steps.description: Blend on low speed, allowing the icing to become slightly liquid-like.

steps.headline: Add the nutmeg and vanilla.
steps.description: Blend until well combined and the icing forms.

steps.headline: Frost the cupcakes.
steps.description: Place the icing in a frosting pipe and pipe a dollop of frosting onto each cupcake.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Sprinkle extra nutmeg on each cupcake if desired. Place the cupcakes on a large serving plate and enjoy!

text: Making the Cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350F (175C).  Line a cupcake tray with paper liners.  Blend the cake mix, eggs, and eggnog in a large bowl. Blend on high speed using an electric mixer until the cake batter resemble a white color. Stir in the nutmeg and vanilla. Blend on medium speed using the electric mixer until well combined. Scoop the batter into a cupcake tray.  Bake the cupcakes for about 18-20 minutes, until they rise and are golden brown.  Allow the cupcakes to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.  Icing and Serving Cream the butter and cream cheese in a medium-sized bowl until light and fluffy.  Fold in the powdered sugar and add the eggnog. Blend on low speed, allowing the icing to become slightly liquid-like. Add the nutmeg and vanilla. Blend until well combined and the icing forms. Frost the cupcakes. Place the icing in a frosting pipe and pipe a dollop of frosting onto each cupcake. Serve. Sprinkle extra nutmeg on each cupcake if desired. Place the cupcakes on a large serving plate and enjoy!
